fields.description:
When a site-admin open other site-admin profile, the buttons for Prompt reset password and Log in as user are disabled and it shows "You do not have enough privileges to prompt this user to reset their password." and  "You do not have enough privileges to log in as this user.".
Please, update the documentation explaining what site-admins should expect when they add other users as site-admins and the reason why they can't reset password.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/give-users-admin-permissions-964957877.html
fields.summary: Update documentation to explain why a site-admin can't reset password for other site-admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Export users feature does not work properly if the field *Only these groups* is empty (no group is selected).
 !Screenshot 2019-02-07 at 5.32.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* Internet Explorer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Internet Explorer (IE) navigate to *Site administration* > *Users* page
# Click on *Export users*
# Perform following actions while no group is selected in *Only these groups*:
#* Click on *Export users* button
#* Select the checkbox options for *Group membership*, *Application access* or *Inactive users*

h3. Expected Results
Users are being exported as a CSV file based on the options selected in _Export users_ page

h3. Actual Results
If the field *Only these groups* is empty, selecting the options or clicking on *Export users* button does not work and a dropdown list of groups appears in *Only these groups* field.

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser to export the users
fields.summary: Export users feature works inconsistently in Internet Explorer (IE)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The page for [Set your site homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-homepage-873871363.html?_ga=2.121693186.800021067.1549283132-1735250289.1546433624] appears to be no longer relevant, yet it is still  public.

{quote}To set your site homepage:

# Go to  >  Site administration.
# Choose Product access in the left panel.
# Hit the User defaults button at the top-right of the page.
# Pick the default application under the Homepage heading.
# Hit Set defaults.
Your users will now land in your selected product when they log in. Note that it can take up to two hours for your changes to take effect.{quote}

However, when you navigate to the Product access page in the new Cloud User Management, there is no User Defaults button. There appears to still be a possibility if you are running the older version of UM.

Is this article no longer relevant? Has the method changed to set a site homepage? Is the feature removed?

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the article with the new method, or remove the article if it's no longer relevant.

h3. Why this is important
Many bugs link to this article as a workaround, which is confusing for Cloud users if it's a feature they can't use anymore.

h3. Workaround
As a Jira Administrator, Edit the Jira Introduction Panel at https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa and include a message with a link to Confluence
fields.summary: Set your site homepage broken

fields.description:
On the previous UI on user management, we could check how long an invitation was sent to the user and if the invitation was expired.

On the new UI, we have only the option to resend the invite, but we don't know if the invitation is still valid and when the user was created to have at least an idea of how long we are waiting for the user to have their first login.

It would be great if we keep this feature in the new UI to have control if the user that we invited (which is consuming a license) is using the Cloud products.
fields.summary: Show how long an invitation was sent on the new UI for User management and if it was expired

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the site-admin ( that is also an org-admin ) opens a managed user information at the site admin's page ( https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/user > select the user ) the Change details are available and it isn't redirecting the admin to the org UI page.

No SAML SSO configuration is configured.
 
h3. Expected Results

Once the site-admin, that is also org-admin, chose Change details option for a managed user, the admin should be redirected to the Organization UI ( at https://admin.atlassian.com ) to proceed with the changes.
h3. Actual Results

When the administrator uses Change details he receives the following pop-up:

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-04 at 3.59.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The users then receive an email to change his information, but when he goes to https://id.atlassian.com he can't proceed with the changes because the account is managed.

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-04 at 4.03.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

This happened on the old admin UI.
h3. Workaround

Go to https://admin.atlassian.com/users > find the user, and change the information.
fields.summary: Wrong behavior of Change details options at the admin's page when the user is managed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After performing deletion of Atlassian account via Id.atlassian, the screen prompts possible reason for the deletion. However, it is not possible to select one as it changes randomly as we choose the radio button.
 - !bug.gif|width=348,height=329!

h3. Environment

id.atlassian.com
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to id.atlassian.com
 # delete account
 # prompts possible reason to be selected

h3. Expected Results

The possible reason is selected and accepted.
h3. Actual Results

Not possible to select one as it changes randomly.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to select the reason for account deletion

fields.description:
We have some users unable to login to their Jira and Confluence Cloud instances. The steps below will fail for them : 
 * If a newly created/invited user
 ## They try to login from invitation email link and fail to login
 ## They try to login directly from the Jira or Confluence site URL which is typically https://<instance>.atlassian.net/login
 ## The error message that appears is 'Your operation is taking longer than usual"
 ## They wait the suggested 10 mins on the error page and retry and issue persists
 !image-2019-02-04-15-02-39-967.png|thumbnail!

We are also tracking this issue via the Atlassian Incident Report here : [https://status.atlassian.com/incidents/lnqxfml6rygc]
fields.summary: Some newly invited users cannot login to Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The suggest changes feature present inside the user administration part of Cloud instances only sends the suggested changes to the user in case both his full name and email are provided.

In case the user only provides/suggests a full name change leaving the email field blank a "(!)*Something went wrong*" message is displayed. When looking at the browser triggered call we can see why the suggest failed:
{code}
{"key":"fieldConstraintsViolated","context":{"fieldViolations":[{"field":"suggestChangeDetails.arg1.email.value","violations":[{"key":"Value is not a valid email address"}]}]}}
{code}

Basically, if you leave the email field blank the suggest fails.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the feature so when the email field is not filled the application uses the current email of the user, the same goes for the name.
 
h3. Workaround 

Manually fill in the current email of the user before triggering the change.
fields.summary: Enhance the suggest changes feature to consider the current email of the user in case nothing is provided

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the old UI at the admin page > *Product access* we used to see the _License usage_:

!usage.png|thumbnail!

information but in the new UI, we don't have that information anymore.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Display that information in the new UI as well because that is the easiest way to control the license usage and identify licenses problems.
fields.summary: Display 'license usage' count in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After group provisioning a managed user, while the Atlassian account is on the deletion process, the Atlassian account becomes inactive and it isn't possible to activate the user at the Organization, the provisioning troubleshooting logs will show the following message:
{code}Unable to enable user <email_address>. This user could be in pending deletion state or blocked due to internal policy.{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce ( using Okta as an example )
 # Create a user under a verified domain ( by inviting to the instance )
 # Trigger the deletion process at the Organization UI, then open the developers' tool and refresh the page to check if the status of the account is "BLOCKED" ( it will appear on a GET log with the name equals to the AAID )
 # Create  and activate the user at Okta 
 # Assign to a group and do the group push ( you must look if the Atlassian account is now with an e-mail address verified and is deactivated, otherwise the issue won't happen )
 # Go to the user at the Organization UI > *managed accounts* and chose *cancel deletion*
 # The user will remain inactive and the reactivate button won't be available

h3. Expected Results

When you *Cancel deletion* the Organization UI should show the user as active, which means the Atlassian account is now active.

h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to activate the user anymore. 

 !Delete.png|thumbnail! 
{code:java}
  "id": "xxxxxxx",
  "userName": "xxxxxxxxx",
  "displayName": "xxxxxxxx",
  "avatarUrl": "xxxxxxxxxxx",
  "jobTitle": "",
  "active": "BLOCKED",
  "useMfa": xxxx,
  "emails": [
    {
      "value": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
      "primary": true,
      "verified": true
      }
{code}
h3. Notes
 * Couldn't reproduce the error without verifying the e-mail address on step 4 
 * Couldn't reproduce the error if the status of step 2 is "DISABLED"

h3. Workaround

[Delete the Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/delete-a-managed-account-961259516.html] and recreate the user.
fields.summary: User can't be activated due to the provisioning process while the user was being deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The search feature in group picker field in user page does not provide the expected results. Please see *Steps to Reproduce* for some tested examples

h3. Environment
* Cloud applications
* User management (new interface)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Use case 1: Search for a group that is not among first 100 results
# Have more than 100 groups, and at least a user account
# Go to User management > Users page
# Select *Show details* for a user account
# In user details page click on *Add to group*
# Search for a group that is not among first 100 groups (alphabetically)

h4. User case 2: Search for a new group without closing "Add a user to groups" dialog
# Go to User management > Users page
# Select *Show details* for a user account
# In user details page click on *Add to group*
# Search for a group
# Select or remove the keyword and search for another group

h3. Expected Results
h4. Use case 1: 
The target group is found
h4. Use case 2: 
The search is being done among all groups, and show the results

h3. Actual Results
h4. Use case 1: 
The target group can't be found
h4. Use case 2: 
The search is being done among results of the previous search (step #4 in use case #2)

h3. Workaround
Contact support at https://support.atlassian.com/
fields.summary: Inconsistent results for group search/picker feature in new user management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After doing a site import from either Cloud or Server the site-admin must approve the imported groups access into the applications which don't work on the new UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Execute a site-import to Cloud
# At the product access page click on *Review imported groups*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-30 at 17.24.26.png|thumbnail! 
# At the pop up try to approve the access of the approved groups:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-30 at 17.24.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

After hitting the approve link the group should be added to the group access settings.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: In the new product access page it's impossible to approve the access of imported groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to remove the group *jira-users* as Default Application Access from any product once added.

h3. Environment
* ADG for User Management

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# If not created, create a group called *jira-users*
# Go to *Product Access* in the User Management
# In any product, click *Add group* and add the *jira-users* group
# The group will automatically receive Default Application Access (in case it didn't, just make the group default)
# Try to remove the group as default.

h3. Expected Results
The group will no longer be a default access group 

h3. Actual Results
The group remains a default access group and no error shows up in the UI.
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Unable to remove the group "jira-users" as default access group in the Application Access configuration in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting members of groups through user management (Export users), the group picker field displays top 100 results alphabetically.

h3. Environment
 This bug affected instances with the new interface for User Management

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have more than 100 groups in the instance
 # Go to *User Management* page
 # Click on *Export users*
 # Select *Users from selected groups only:*
 !User manangement - Export users.png|thumbnail!
 # Search and/or select a group that is not among top 100 groups (sorted alphabetically)

h3. Expected Results

Group is found and could be selected
h3. Actual Results

Any group that is not among top 100 results is not searchable or selectable
h3. Workaround
Contact support at https://support.atlassian.com/
fields.summary: Group picker fields displays only first 100 results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add a user to a group from within the user profile the group search popup doesn't refresh with the backend results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group
 # From the user profile of a user try to find that group

(!) The issue is intermittent so you may not be able to reproduce it all the times.

h3. Expected Results

The group should be returned in the list and selectable to add the user to it.

h3. Actual Results

The group is not returned and the list is not updated:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-28 at 16.07.41.png|thumbnail! 

On the backend search we can see that the group is actually returned:
{code}
`{"total":1,"groups":[{"id":"c861df92-5159-4323-a12f-35626652e5f1","name":"zimbe","description":"","productPermissions":[],"defaultForProducts":[],"sitePrivilege":"NONE","userTotal":0,"unmodifiable":false,"managementAccess":"ALL","ownerType":null}]}`
{code}

So the UI is failing to update the list.

h3. Workaround
Add the user to the group that doesn't show up from the group page.
fields.summary: Group search from user profile doesn't return all groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Cloud admin UI the _site-admins_ can't impersonate users that have never logged in (Users > Show details > Log in as user):
!image.png|thumbnail!

Some admins use that feature to check if the user is able to access the projects and spaces they should be before the user to make the permissions corrections if needed.
 
h3. Suggested Solutions
Make is possible for site-admins to impersonate the users as it was in the old UI.
fields.summary: Can't impersonate a user before his/her first login in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Jira or Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the User Management area
# un-tick the box for _Users can invite others_
# With this functionality disabled, regular users can still _invite_ other people and this invitation will not grant access but send an access request to the site-admins

h3. Expected Results
With this functionality disabled, regular users cannot invite other users at all

h3. Actual Results
Regular users can still invite other users, but these newly invited users will not have access directly granted. An access request will be created for site-admins to approve

h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Disabling the _Users can invite others_ tickbox still allows regular users to invite other people

fields.description:
At this moment, the user management page seamlessly covers access to Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud under one roof. However, Bitbucket Cloud user management is completely separated.

Please unify the 3 products from a user management perspective, so that access can be granted easier to any of the 3 products.
fields.summary: Unify user management between Jira/Confluence Cloud and Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new user profile UI is not updating the last access date for JIRA products:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 18.42.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access JIRA
# Load your profile under the new UI

h3. Expected Results

The Last seen date should be set to the last time the User used Jira

h3. Actual Results

It displays "Never used this product".

h3. Workaround

Use the [export users feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/export-users-833925313.html] to see what's the actual last date your users accessed JIRA.
fields.summary: The new user profile page does not update the last access date for JIRA products, it only displays "Never used this product".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud with the new User Management interface
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on a user to add them to a group
 # In the modal that appears, scroll to the bottom, attempting to add the user to the last group in the list
 # Notice that the scroll bar does not reach the bottom of the list

h3. Expected Results

Scrolling down would work until reaching the end of the list
h3. Actual Results

A site-admin can only scroll up to a certain point. The scroll bar indicator on the right reaches its bottom position without reaching the bottom of the list
h3. Notes

This bug is mainly observed in the Cloud sites that have a large number of groups.
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the groups page, click on a group and add the user there. This is cumbersome if a site-admin needs to add a user to many groups.

Or, search for the group name
fields.summary: Adding a user to a group - the scroll bar of the modal does not reach the end

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The User Management has moved to the new experience. After the changes, the "License Usage" and "User with Acces" sections no longer showing under "Product Access"
h3. Suggested Solution

Bring back "License Usage" and "User with Acces" sections on the new view.
h3. Why this is important

The information is important as it helps admin to:L
 * Estimate the bill
 * Identify how many active users for each product
 * Identify who are the users that count to the license

h3. Workaround

Get the bill estimation via:
 * Go to *Billing > Bill estimate* to check the current bill usage (how many users)
 * or, *Billing > Manage subscriptions*

Get who has the access to the application via:
 # Go to *Users*, click on *Export users* button
 # Make sure to check *Application access*
 # Download the user list and view the access from the file
fields.summary: "License Usage" and "User with Access" sections no longer showing on new experience

fields.description:
h3. "This action isn't available in our new experience" pop-up is displayed at the bottom of the window

h3. Steps to Reproduce ]
# Go to *User Management* 
# Select a user without *site-admin* permissions and click *Log in as user*

h3. Expected Behavior
* Everything works as expected

h3. Actual Behavior
* A pop-up appears at the bottom left of the screen saying:

{quote}
*This action isn't available in our new experience*
Switch back to the previous experience to complete this action. Don't worry, you won't lose any functionality.
{quote}

And after a couple of seconds it properly loads into the user's profile.

h3. Workaround.

Currently there are no workarounds for this. Once any are available, we'll update it here.
fields.summary: "This action isn't available in our new experience" pop-up is displayed at the bottom of the window once you impersonate a user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be great to have a feature that shows in the Atlassian Accounts profile (https://id.atlassian.com) the information of products/instances the account has access to. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature at https://id.atlassian.com that make it possible for the users to see the products/instances they have access to. It could be something similar to the *product access* information we got from the [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] > *Managed accounts* at the user's profile.
fields.summary: Show the products/instances the Atlassian Account has access to

fields.description:
At the moment, deleting an Atlassian account for managed users is only possible via Atlassian Organization. GSuite admins are not able to perform this for their users as a self service. This is useful for GSuite admins for cases when a member leaves their organization

*Suggestion* :
Implement an option for GSuite admins to delete the Atlassian Account of their Users.
fields.summary: GSuite admin option for deleting Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The exported field values may contain comma (such as in username, full_name or email), and the comma possibly conflict with CSV separator.
h3. Suggested Solution

Escape all fields with a pair of double quotes. This doesn't violate [RFC 4180|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comma-separated_values], and most of CSV library or application (e.g. Excel) can handle such a format.
h3. Workaround

None. You can find entries where the number of fields (8 in this case) is larger than expected, and fix the data manually:
{code:bash}
awk -F ',' 'NF>8 { print $0 }' ~/Downloads/export-users.csv
{code}
fields.summary: Escape all CSV fields with double quotes in user export

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

User export feature in user management (at [https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/admin/users|https://example.atlassian.net/admin/users]) exports CSV file containing addon app accounts like below:
{code:none}
addon_confluence-chats-integration,Chat Notifications,confluence-chats-integration@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,31 Aug 2018,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_com.atlassian.jira.chat,Jira App for Chat,com.atlassian.jira.chat@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,26 Oct 2017,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_jira-workplace-integration,Jira Cloud for Workplace,jira-workplace-integration@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,28 Apr 2018,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions,Jira Misc Workflow Extensions,com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,21 Sep 2016,Not active in the last 180 days,Not active in the last 180 days,Not active in the last 180 days
addon_jira-ops-confluence-integration,Jira Ops Confluence integration,jira-ops-confluence-integration@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,16 Nov 2018,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded,Jira Service Desk Widget,com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,26 Oct 2017,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_jira-sketch-integration,Sketch,jira-sketch-integration@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,26 Oct 2017,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_jira-slack-integration,Slack,jira-slack-integration@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,26 Oct 2017,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_stspg-jira-ops,Statuspage for Jira,stspg-jira-ops@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,27 Aug 2018,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_jira-trello-integration,Trello,jira-trello-integration@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,26 Oct 2017,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
addon_cello,Trello,cello@connect.atlassian.com,Yes,21 Sep 2017,Never logged in,Never logged in,Never logged in
{code}
This is not preferable for admins who want to get the data of "actual users".
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to exclude addon app accounts.
h3. Workaround

Perform the command like below to extract non-addon users:
{code}
cat ~/Downloads/export-users.csv | grep -v @connect.atlassian.com > "export-users-$(date +%s).csv"
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to exclude addon app accounts from user export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Atlassian Access Managed Accounts, accounts are showing with a deactivated JIRA product.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to Atlassian Access and claim your domain
# Add Confluence application to your Cloud instance
# Sign up for JIRA Core application and JIRA Ops
# Deactivate JIRA Core and JIRA Ops

h3. Expected Results
Only Confluence is showing in the managed account page

h3. Actual Results
JIRA product (deactivated) is showing on the admin managed account

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Managed Account shows deactivated product

fields.description:
h3. Issue statement
Since the release of ADG3 for the user management page, User properties and user roles are missing for the users.
The customer uses the user properties to trigger some post function on the workflow.

Even the endpoint below does not work to be used as a workaround.
https://[instance-name].atlassian.net/secure/admin/user/EditUserProperties.jspa?name=[username]

h3. Expected Result
To be able to update the user property on the screen

h3. Actual result
No button or tab available to update the user properties.

h3. Workaround
No workaround found
fields.summary: User properties and user roles are missing in ADG3, new user management screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When the user is deleted in Gsuite, their account is only deactivated in the cloud site. This causes extra work as the admin has to manually delete the account again in the instance.
h3. Suggested Solutions

When the user is deleted in Gsuite, also delete the user in the instance on the next sync.
fields.summary: When the user is deleted in Gsuite, also delete them in the cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When having your instance synced with the User-provisioning feature you will likely have synced groups to have your provisioned users granted application access.

This requires the groups to be added at the product access configuration which in the new update does not list these synced IdP groups.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up the user provisioning feature in your Organization and link it to an instance.
# With your users synced to the instance, try to add them into the application access page:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-14 at 18.02.49.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-14 at 17.55.57.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-14 at 18.03.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The synced groups should be listed to be added.

h3. Actual Results

The synced groups are not listed
 
h3. Workaround

Contact support.

h3. Related documentation

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-with-okta-957492956.html
fields.summary: New product access page does not list SCIM groups when adding groups to applications

fields.description:
h3. *Feature Request Statement*

Customer would like to have the option to remove *Log in with Google*  option from his personal account, due to security issues.
fields.summary: Remove Log in with Google option

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new group's view is counting _system-users._

*Note:* this bug does not impact the billing, that being said, there will be no extra charges regarding this problem.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Site Administration* > *Groups*.
 # In the image the *Members* count fro _jira-software-users_ (10).
!ngv.png|width=421,height=204!
 # Accessing the group there are 3 members (non _system-users_).
!group.png|width=302,height=225!
 # When exporting the users' list (Users > Export > mark *Group membership) we can see the 10 users related to that group (3 regular users and 7 _system-users_).
!user_export.png|width=252,height=188!

h3. Expected Results

The _Members_ count should not consider _system-users_ since they don't consume licenses and they are not 'manageable' users.
h3. Actual Results

The _system-users_ are being added to the total of _Members_ displayed at the new Group's view.
fields.summary: The new group's view is counting system-users as groups members

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new group's view is counting _system-users._

*Note:* this bug does not impact the billing, that being said, there will be no extra charges regarding this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Site Administration* > *Groups*.
 # In the image the *Members* count fro _jira-software-users_ (10).
 !ngv.png|thumbnail!
 # Accessing the group there are 3 members (non _system-users_).
 !group.png|thumbnail!
 # When exporting the users' list (Users > Export > mark *Group membership) we can see the 10 users related to that group (3 regular users and 7 _system-users_).
 !user_export.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The _Members_ count should not consider _system-users_ since they don't consume licenses and they are not 'manageable' users.
h3. Actual Results

The _system-users_ are being added to the total of _Members_ displayed at the new Group's view.


h5. Notes

By opening the developer console of your browser it's possible to find the GET call that fetches the users and at the response, you can see which system users are being counted as members of the group but don't show up at the list.

The name of the call is:
{code}
members?count=20&start-index=1
{code}
fields.summary: The new group's view is counting system-users as groups members.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer isn't being able to change her personal detail ( Nickname ) to a <NULL> value on [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in at [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/]
 # Add a <NULL> value to *Nickname* field
 # Hit *Save changes*

h3. Expected Results
 - *Nickname* field is updated to <NULL> value

or
 - Message informing why *Nickname* field can't be <NULL>

h3. Actual Results

 
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-28 at 16.33.26.png|thumbnail! 

 
 While checking into the HAR file, we can see that both the POSTs responsible for the change are returning status HTTP 200 OK:
{code:java}
Request URL: https://as.atlassian.com/api/v1/t
HTTP Version: http/2.0
Request method: POST
Remote Address: xxxxxxxxx
{code}
Fragment of the POST data shows that the two fields for fullName and nickname were changed and the save button was clicked.
{code:javascript}
"attributes":{
"numFieldsChanged":2,
"fieldsChanged":"fullName, nickname"
},
"tags":[],
"eventType":"ui"},
"event":"saveChanges clicked",
"anonymousId":"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
"timestamp":"xxxxxxxxxxx",
"type":"track",
"writeKey":"",
"userId":"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
"sentAt":"xxxxxxxxx"
{code}
Second call shows which values went through:
{code:java}
Request URL: https://api-private.atlassian.com/directory/graphql
HTTP Version: http/2.0
Request method: POST
Remote Address: xxxxxxxxxxxxx
{code}
Post data:
{code:javascript}
{
  "query": "mutation UserDetails($userId: String!, $profileData: UserInput) {\n    ProfileDetails: updateUser(id: $userId, input: $profileData) {\n      id,\n      isCurrentUser,\n      status,\n      fullName,\n      nickname,\n      title,\n      timezone,\n      location,\n      companyName,\n      department,\n      avatarUrl(size: 200),\n    }\n  }",
  "variables": {
    "userId": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
    "profileData": {
      "fullName": "xxxxxxxxx",
      "nickname": ""
    }
  }
{code}
The data posted matches what the customer said was done, changes to the data leaving the nickname blank.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: NULL value for Nickname cause generic error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Updating the Outgoing email notification using a capital letter shows an error as "Domain Claim failed", even if it's everything else configured just fine.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify your domain and create the Org
 # Add the SPF and DKIM records
 # Make sure that you are logged in with an account that is either the site-admin and org admin.
 # Go to a project Notification scheme and try to update the outgoing email using a capital letter.

 * For example: Test@Example.com

h3. Expected Results

The outgoing(notification) email should be updated just fine.
h3. Actual Results

You receive a generic error saying that the "Domain Claim has failed for this domain".
h3. Workaround

Input the email using only lowercase letters.
fields.summary: Updating the Outgoing email notification using a capital letter shows an error as "Domain Claim failed"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When your account is self-managed and you don't have the _two-step verification_ code to authenticate you log in at Atlassian regardless the cause (i.e. lost the smartphone) and also don't have the _recovery code_ you can proceed with the *send recovery email* step described at [secure your account with 2FA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html#Secureyouraccountwithtwo-stepverification-troubleTroubleshoottwo-stepverification] documentation. That process takes 48 hours to be completed due to security matters. 

The steps to trigger that through the UI is basically:
# Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com 
# Type the email and password
# If the email and password are correct, the _verification code_ will be asked then click on *Can't use your phone?*
# The _emergency code_ will be asked then click on *Can't find your recovery key?*
# Click on *Send recovery email*

The issue is, whenever you repeat this process through the UI or using an expired _recovery link_ that process will be triggered again so the user will wait for another 48 hours.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a method/mechanism that locks the trigger for a new _recovery link_ after that process is already in progress.
fields.summary: Lock the 2FA recovery link for Atlassian Accounts after it has already been triggered

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The message under the option "Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join:" is not clear and can cause some difficulties while adding the domains.

!Screen Shot 2018-12-21 at 16.57.03.png|width=559,height=96!

Pressing enter to add is a necessary step that is not informed at any moment during the process. Also, if the user just types the domain and try to click on "Save Changes" nothing happens.
h3. Suggested Solution

1 - Change message to *Type the domain and press enter to Add*. Separate domains with space. We'll notify you about all new users.
2 - Once you click on Save Changes, save the information that is added in the field.
fields.summary: Change the text when adding domains in Site Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user has the new UI for the Manage Groups page, it only displays *the first 17 groups* of the list.

The other groups still existing but are only accessible when searching them. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Manage Groups page
# Add 17 groups. It'll display all the groups normally. 
# Add *one more group* and then +refresh the page+

h3. Expected Results
It should list the groups within one page or allow the user to navigate through other pages

h3. Actual Results
The *next page* icon is blocked and the last groups are not displayed on the UI

h3. Notes
The group still existing. You only can't see it on the UI

h3. Workaround
Search for the group is a workaround when *you know the group name*. Otherwise, you'll need to guess the group name to be able to search it.

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, once users are added to a group in the new UI, the counter is increased accordingly. The bug presents itself, once you remove users from the group. 

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Open your *Site Administration*
# Go to *Groups*
# Add some users to a group, ie. confluence-users
# Go back to the *Groups* page and check the member's counter
# Now, remove some users from the group
# Check the counter again

h3. Expected Results
The counter will display the information properly

h3. Actual Results
The counter is not updated. In some cases, it seems that logging out, and back in again fixes the counter, although I couldn't replicate this.

The below error is displayed when trying to invite users to the instance using the new User Management interface.

h3. Expected Results
The user  is invited with no issues

h3. Actual Results

 !Cannot-invite-users.png|thumbnail!

In the developer tools you can see that the request to https://INSTANCE/gateway/api/adminhub/um/site/CLOUD-ID/users/invite failing and:

{available=0, needed=1}, conf=LicenseExceeded{available=0, needed=1}}"}}
{noformat}
- Some other times it returns error 500 and the below response: {noformat}
{"timestamp":"2018-12-13T16:29:02.654+0000","status":500,"error":"Internal Server Error","exception":"com.netflix.zuul.exception.ZuulException","message":"GENERAL"}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Managed user without Atlassian Access can use 1 character password
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue:
 # Have a domain, create an organization and verify it.
 # Do not subscribe to the Atlassian Access (and hence don't set any password policy).
 # Try to set a single digit password  

h3. Expected Results
You cannot set a single digit password because of the default password policy (a password length of 8 - 100 characters) 

h3. Actual Results
The password is successfully changed and you are able to log-in using a single digit password.


h3. Suggested Solution
Default Atlassian Password policies should be enforced even if the user's email address is a part of verified domain and has no custom password policies setup.


h3. Workaround
Temporary subscribe to Atlassian Access, set a password policy and then unsubscribe. According to the documentation in this case the password policy we just set will still be used.
fields.summary: Managed user without Atlassian Access can use 1 character password

Hi,

We recently released an improved version of the G Suite integration, as part of Atlassian Access, that supports syncing G Suite groups. Learn all about the changes in this blog post.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/10/were-changing-g-suite-settings-and-giving-you-a-free-upgrade-for-6-months]

Thank you,

Narmada Jayasankar

Lead Product Manager, Atlassian Access

h3. Summary

After deleting a Cloud product from one's instance the default access groups previously configured for that product will remain unchanged at the instance and undeletable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have two products in an instance, Confluence and JIRA for example.
# Add users to the default group of one of the products.
# Remove that product

h3. Expected Results

The product default groups should be removed as the application is no longer active in the instance.

h3. Actual Results

The groups remain active and show as default access groups so you can't delete them as well.

fields.description:
*Problem*
In Jira, if an instance has more than 5 users the fields 'Full name' and 'Email address' don't appear above the users' list.

*Suggestion*
Despite the Atlassian Accounts idea, it should be perfectly acceptable to still allow the administrator to add a full name to the invitation because the user is still free to change it. This would prevent the problem where the email address is used as their default Full-Name in the invitation, resulting in more work afterward.

In fact, some users are not aware of this. So, some of them don't change the Full-Name because they thought the instance admin had chosen it to be so and did not want to cause problems; other ones simply don't notice, and others sometimes are in a hurry and don't care.
fields.summary: Site-admins should be able allowed to add users' Full-Name when sending an invite to them.

Youve = You've

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The feature is to provide a way for existing users to Requests Access to another product (within the same site) that they don't have access to, and to allow existing users to Request Access for new users.

*Note*: This feature does +not+ allow users to self signup, but to only request access via an Admin. The existing 'Users can invite other users' checkbox in the Site Access settings, allows a user to invite another user without any Admin approval.
h3. Suggested Solution

Improve Request Access to allow Admins to:
#  Allow admins to turn this off completely if it doesn't fit their access approval procedure.*
#  Configure the 'Grant Access’ button to give access to default groups + custom groups / projects
#  Allow admins to receive the notifications in the system, and/or define a particular group to receive the notification (so not all site admins have to receive it)
#  Handle duplicate requests for access correctly (i.e. only show one request)
#  Remove requests for access if the admin grants access via Groups, the User List or User Details page
# Create an additional option to ignore the request in cases where the administrator does not want to revoke this access forever.

*Currently in development:*
#  Update the "Grant Access" and "Deny Access" buttons to reflect what they actually do, "Approve Request" (which adds the product access) and "Deny Request" (which does nothing to any existing product access, but just denies the request...)
# Fix the pagination issue for large lists of requests

*Completed:*
#  Provide a better indicator on the Admin page that there are pending access requests
fields.summary: Improve Request Access feature

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently if a user has only Confluence or Jira access not both and is given the base URL for the instance as a starting point they are not re-directed based on their application access.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the default application homepage to be defined on a per-user basis or to be defined by their application access permissions. So if they only have Confluence access this would be set by default, however if they have both this can be set.

Perhaps make it user configurable instead of just site-admin?
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Specify default application homepage per user

fields.description:
h3. Current situation

At the moment, when a user is deactivated with both application access (Jira and Confluence) and reacivated through G-suite with only application access to Confluence. There is no possible to tell G-suite to remap the application access as the reactivating was done referring to the Google ID.

h3. Suggestion

When reactivating a user through G-Suite, allow admin to configure or map a G-Suite Group to a specific application access (JIRA or Confluence or Both)

h3. Why this is important?

When there is user reactivated, they could be giving access to the content which they are not supposed to due to the confidentiality of the content. It's crucial for G-suite to be able to map the application access when a user is reactivated.
fields.summary: Improve application access when reactivating user through G-suite

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At https://id.atlassian.com/login, the message *"Incorrect email address and / or password"* is shown only for the first three login attempts.
Since this threshold continues even after a user changes browser, there's no explicit way for the user to know why he/she fails to login.


h3. Suggested Solution

Keep showing the message "Incorrect email address and / or password".

 !Screenshot 2018-10-25 14.26.07.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2018-10-25 14.25.42.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Keep showing the reason why login attempt failed even after 4th times failure

h3. Summary
Some users are unable to receive email notifications to their Atlassian accounts. 
One of the sendgrid IP dedicated to [Atlassian|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] is blacklisted by an external system: [https://mxtoolbox.com/SuperTool.aspx?action=blacklist%3a168.245.65.50&run=toolpage]
Removing the block does not help. Since the sendgrid IP is blacklisted, the user is moved to blocked list again.

h3. Workaround
As a workaround customer can whitelist the IP's listed [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html]
fields.summary: Few atlassian accounts unable to receive emails since some Sendgrid IP's dedicated to the Atlassian account are on blacklist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-1391].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 31 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

When we released JIRA 6 with support for renaming users, we considered this feature as well as our team was focused on managing the issues with users in JIRA and external directories; however, we elected not to delay the release of JIRA 6 by implementing it. 

Since this request was first created, user management in JIRA has become much more complex. Many of our  customers use LDAP directories, integrate JIRA with Google Apps, and in the future will connect other SSO providers via SAML (ID-80). Therefore, we will need to re-evaluate the best way to support this at our next opportunity.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description:*
 
As a JIRA administrator I am responsible for managing a large installation with multiple users and groups. Given the dynamic nature of my environment it is very difficult for me to create the correct user group name which can be used for many projects later on. I need to be able to rename the user groups, to reflect the changes my organisation undergoes.
fields.summary: Renaming groups after creation.

fields.description:
h3. The Problem
Currently we have three defaults for users Permissions:
- Basic: assigns jira-software-users/jira-servicedesk-user
- Trusted: assigns jira-software-users/jira-servicedesk-user and administrators
- Site administrator: assigns jira-software-users/jira-servicedesk-user and site-admin

h3. The Suggestion
Add a way to edit those groups for a more granular approach when assigning permissions.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to configure default groups for Trusted Users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attempting to use a vertical smart phone image as an avatar for user profile will display as a vertical image and not honor the correct orientation in EXIF details.

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Take a vertical image with a smart phone, don't modify it.
Navigate to your profile in a Cloud instance
Attempt to change your avatar to this image, you'll see that it's displayed incorrectly, as a horizontal image.

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-22 at 2.35.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Confirmed using:
* Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge (Android 8.0)
* iPhone 7 Plus (iOS 12.1)

h3. Expected Results
It's expected the rotation would be the same as honored on the phone.

h3. Actual Results
EXIF rotation is not honored 

h3.Workaround
I find that if I modify the image slightly (in my case, increase brightness by 1 degree) then it's displayed properly.
fields.summary: EXIF Image Rotation not supported

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, you can only search by a user's name when adding users to a group via the group page: <instance>/admin/groups
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to search by email address

h3. Why this is important
It would be very difficult for admins to add users to a group if they only have a list of email addresses.

h3. Workaround 
Search the users through user page <instance>/admin/users and add the group to the users one at a time.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow admin to search by email address when adding a user to a group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In User Management, we can create the user with the same email address even though the user had been created as "Portal Only Customer".

h3. Customer Impact
* The user would have duplicate accounts in the instance
* User unable to access Jira even though they have granted the permissions

h3. Environment
* Jira Service Desk is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Service Desk project, go to *Customers* list
# Invite a user to the project
# Go to *User Management > Users"
# Invite the user with the same email address again

h3. Expected Results
It should prompt a message where the email address already exists.

h3. Actual Results
The user got created successfully and now user have 2 active accounts in the same instance,

h3.Workaround
# Go to *User Management > Jira Service Desk > Portal only customers*
# Look for the affected user
# Migrate the user to Atlassian Account
!screenshot.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Duplicate Accounts In Jira (Portal only customer and Atlassian Account)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

_Log in with Google_ authentication method 'by-pass' the Atlassian Account's _*two-factor authentication*_
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a _Atlassian Account_ linked with a Gmail email address.
 # Enable _Two-step verification_ at [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] by following the steps described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html#Secureyouraccountwithtwo-stepverification-Enabletwo-stepverification].
 # Using _Log in with Google_ method will redirect the user to Google > authenticate the user's credentials > redirect the user to [https://id.atlassian.com/] without requesting the _2FA_ code.

(!) In case you created the account with _Log in with Google_ you will need to create a password for the Atlassian Account with the reset password method triggered at [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword] to be able to configure the _2FA_.
h3. Expected Results

_Log in with Google_ should result in the correct workflow: Google authentication > _2FA_ verification > grant access to [https://id.atlassian.com/].
h3. Actual Results

After Google authentication, the user is directly redirected to [https://id.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: "Log in with Google" authentication method 'by-pass' the Atlassian Account's 2FA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In cases where the customer lost his/her device (but kept the same phone number), issues between the app sync with Atlassian or didn't save the recovery key the use of both methods will help the customer to authenticate without having to wait 48 hours for the recovery email as per [Atlassian's documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html#Secureyouraccountwithtwo-stepverification-troubleTroubleshoottwo-stepverification].
h3. Suggested Solutions

Make it possible to get the verification code with both the app and phone number methods at the same time.
fields.summary: Make it possible to have MFA set in the verified app and SMS

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now when a problem happens while adding a new user to a group the UI only displays:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-12 at 11.50.04.png|thumbnail! 

The same goes when trying to add a user to a group from the user profile while in the new UI.

Looking at the post error through the developer panel of the browser we can clearly see the root cause of the problem:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
{"key":"badRequest","context":{"message":"Unable to add users to groups without exceeding licence"}}
{noformat}

The error was handled when trying to add the user to the group through the old user profile:
!Screen Shot 2018-10-12 at 11.54.39.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the error messages for the new groups/users UI to let the user aware of why the group addition didn't work.

h3. Notes

This message "Something went wrong" also applies for cases where a site-admin is inviting new users and suggesting changes to users account.
fields.summary: Enhance error messages for the new Groups/Users page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the creation of Atlassian Accounts, users no longer have their details (full name, email address, account password) managed on the instance side, instead, it is managed at id.atlassian.com (when the account is self-managed) or at [G Suite|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enable-or-disable-g-suite-integration-873918510.html] / [Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/organization-administration-938859734.html] (when the account is managed by an admin). That said, the _Full Name_ option is not useful anymore and might confuse the site-administrators that invite users with a different 'Full Name' from their Atlassian Account (i.e. invite _Joseph Joestar_ but the Atlassian Account full name is _JoJo_).
h3. Suggested Solutions

Remove "Full Name" field from "Invite new users" section at site administration
fields.summary: Remove "Full Name" field from "Invite new users" section at site administration page

fields.description:
Currently, in Atlassian Cloud only site-administrators users can manage users, this also grants users billing access and the ability to add/remove/modify components. 

As per customer feedback, User management should be a separate item from billing and modifying anything/everything about the site and the subscription. There are plenty of examples of user management that does not require billing access, as the customer may have someone he trusts to manage the users but to limit exposure they would not want them to have full site-admin access to those other items. 

Reference documentation:
*https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-users-and-groups-744721623.html
fields.summary: Provide administrators group ability to manage users without being site-admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new group's view is counting _system-users._

*Note:* this bug does not impact the billing, that being said, there will be no extra charges regarding this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Site Administration* > *Groups*.
 # In the image the *Members* count fro _jira-software-users_ (10).
 !ngv.png|thumbnail!
 # Accessing the group there are 3 members (non _system-users_).
 !group.png|thumbnail!
 # When exporting the users' list (Users > Export > mark *Group membership) we can see the 10 users related to that group (3 regular users and 7 _system-users_).
 !user_export.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The _Members_ count should not consider _system-users_ since they don't consume licenses and they are not 'manageable' users.
h3. Actual Results

The _system-users_ are being added to the total of _Members_ displayed at the new Group's view.
fields.summary: The new group's view is counting system-users as groups members.

fields.description: Currently when user trying to log in from id.atlassian.com, they will be redirected to a page where the manual login and "Login with Google" are available for the user to login to their instances. If would be useful if the ability to remove the manual login is enabled so that user could always use the login with Google to log in to the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to disable manual login

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is only CAPTCHA popup in place whenever a user fails to login multiple time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature to lock down the Atlassian Account login and send an email to recover the password.
fields.summary: Lock the login form after multiple failed login attempts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new group's view (Site Admin > Groups > Select a group), we can't see if the users are active or not and that is important to better manage users' licenses and access. 
*New view*
!new.png|thumbnail!

*Old view*
!old.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add that label in the new view.
fields.summary: Add users' status label to the new groups' view screen.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new group management page in Atlassian cloud, users are unable to search for email addresses when adding a user in a group.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 users
||Full Name||Email||
|test user1|test.1user@org.org|
|test user2|test.2user@org.org|
|test user3|test.3user@org.org|
# Try to search for the email of user1 to add in a group.

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to search for "test.1" and the test user1 will be returned.

h3. Actual Results

At the moment, it is only possible to search for the full name and not the email address.

Full name search :

 !Full Name 2.png|thumbnail!  !Full name.png|thumbnail! 

Email search :

 !Email 2.png|thumbnail!  !Email.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to search by email in group management

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Password policy enforcement does not sent out email to all users to change their password. This is for scenarios where the Atlassian Access Organisation has more then 1 domain claimed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Organisation  
 # Claim more then 1 domain in the above organisation
 # Then go the password policy area [https://admin.atlassian.com/o/xxxxxx/passwordpolicy|https://admin.atlassian.com/o/f1e4949e-fe57-4f6a-891b-d333d5cdc043/passwordpolicy] 
 # Click on "Reset Passwords"
 # No email is received from the organisation members to reset the password

h3. Expected Results
 # Click on "Reset Passwords" - expectation is as highlighted there 
{quote}All users will be logged out and prompted to change their passwords. If you are subscribed to Atlassian Access, new passwords will have to comply with your existing password policy.
{quote}
 # The "prompted to change their passwords" seems to imply that a reset email will be sent to customers to change email 

h3. Actual Results

 There is no email sent to all users on all domains under the organisation as expected. This behavior is however expected as there is no engine running a password reset when the above "Reset Button" is used. However users will be prompted to change their passwords upon their next login.
fields.summary: Reset Password at password policy change on Organisations with Multiple Domain does not send out emails as expected

fields.description:
Google Logins are no longer allowed in Mobile Apps webview and must use Google SignIn SDK instead. This requires us to intercept the Google SignIn flow first, if we don't intercept, then the login would still fail.

This makes a SAML --> Google configuration impossible to work on mobile apps, the correct flow should be Google --> SAML.

More details about this on the following blog shared by Google:
 * [Modernizing OAuth interactions in Native Apps for Better Usability and Security|https://developers.googleblog.com/2016/08/modernizing-oauth-interactions-in-native-apps.html]
fields.summary: Google Login inside a SAML Login is not supported in Mobile Apps

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 

Currently, when site access is set to '*Anyone can join*' its shown in Jira as '*Only invited users can join*'
h3. Customer Impact

 

Customers will think the instance doesn't allow self-signup when it does

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 

Change site access to *Anyone can join* and it will show as *Only invited users can join*, however; when you visit the instance from an unknown Atlassian account, you can sign up.

 
 !image-2018-09-24-19-09-32-092.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

 

For the selected checkbox to be *Anyone can join*
h3. Actual Results

The selected checkbox is *Only invited users can join*
h3. Notes

It works, it just doesn't display the right checkbox, so it looks like the instance is set to *Only invited users can join*
h3. Workaround

None available
fields.summary: Currently, when site access is set to 'Anyone can join' it shows in Jira as 'Only invited users can join'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using export account functionality in admin.atlassian.com , in the list of user it shows there is jira core allocation eventhough in the instance it stated, the user does not have jira-core product access

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Verify domain 
# Go to admin.atlassian.com
# Access the organization
# Click on managed accounts
# Monitor a user that has jira-core product
# Go to the instance of the user that has jira-core access 
# Click on the user

h3. Expected Results
Should have jira-core application checkbox

h3. Actual Results
Does not have and only shows other than jira-core

h3. Notes
i notice when reactivating the Jira Core app, it does show as jira core is included with other jira products

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Export account shows jira core user allocation though the user does not have jira core access in instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no product for Jira Portfolio in *Product Access*, hence site-admins are not able to view the *Last Activity* for Jira Portfolio.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature to allow site-admins to view *Last Activity* for a user for Jira Portfolio.
fields.summary: Implement Last Activity for Jira Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing the default homepage setting (under product access > user defaults) to *Confluence*, breaks the login procedure and triggers an authentication error "This operation is taking longer than usual". Most likely due to the number of redirects which some browsers may block.


h3. Environment
* Tested with Chrome and IE
* (!) Doesn't happen with IE 
* Requires both Jira and Confluence subscriptions in the same site

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to "Product Access" (under the site management session) > "User defaults"
# Change the "Default Homepage" setting to "Confluence"
# Create a user with access only to *Jira* 
# When logged out, navigate to https://instance.atlassian.net/ (without anything after the last /, to ensure you're triggering the default homepage behavior).
# Log in

h3. Expected Results
Jira user to be logged in Jira without any error

h3. Actual Results
The following error message appears
 !image-2018-09-19-11-06-04-049.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
*The reverse does not happen (user has only Confluence and Default Homepage set to Jira)*
 
h3.Workaround
* After seeing the error, navigate to  https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/secure you should be logged in even if the error happened.
or
* Change the "Default Homepage" setting to Jira
fields.summary: Setting the "Default Homepage" to Confluence causes an authentication error for Jira only users

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Reset password e-mails have a button to trigger the password reset. In some platforms (Outlook for ex), sometimes this button *does not* work.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Include a link to the password reset page that users can copy/paste directly to browser, so that reseting the password is possible.

h3. *Why this is important*
Customers sometimes cannot reset their password via e-mail
fields.summary: Include Password Reset Link to E-mail

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently by default when the site admin enables the option to add users via the self-signup feature i.e *Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join*, the site admin gets email notification by default for all the new users created which is working as expected.


 Once the above feature is enabled, *notification about new users* is checked and greyed out. The customer wants this feature to be available so that he can uncheck the option in *notification about new users* and hence get no notification when the users are added using the self-signup option

!Screen Shot 2018-09-14 at 5.32.32 PM.png|width=544,height=274!
h3. Suggested Solution

To enable the *Notification about new users* in site access when self-signup feature i.e *Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join* is selected.
h3. Workaround

No workaround to tackle the issue.
fields.summary: Disable email notification for selected domains self sign-up

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Self Signup setting defaults to 'Anyone can join' when adding a domain if ENTER is not typed or a click made away from the field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Site Access and enable "Anyone with on of the following email address domains can join"
# Enter a domain, make sure not to click or type anything else than the domain
# Click Save - notice about a second after saving the option changes to "Anyone can join"
# Re-Enter the domain, this time type ENTER or click away from the field - you will notice the domain now becomes a label
# Click - it will now save as expected

h3. Expected Results
* The setting is saved and it stays as is even if the field was not 'rendedered' into a label

h3. Actual Results
* The setting saves for one second and then changes to 'Anyone can join' the site

 
h3. Notes
This happens pretty quickly and could be easy for a user to miss, opening up their Jira to self signup from any domain

h3.Workaround
Make *sure* to type ENTER or click away from the field before clicking SAVE
fields.summary: Self Signup setting defaults to 'Anyone can join' when adding a domain if ENTER is not typed or a click made away from the field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On IE11 and Firefox, the option to Export Users on the Portal only customer page does not work

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Firefox version 62.0
* IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *User Management* > *Jira Service desk* > *Portal only customers*
# Click on "Export users"


h3. Expected Results
The loading circle will appear and the button will be grayed out for a few seconds and the file will be automatically downloaded, or a save/open pop-up will appear to open or save the file (depending on the "Downloads" browser setting. 

h3. Actual Results
The loading circle will appear and the button will be grayed out, but no file is downloaded or no pop-up appears. Nothing happens. 

h3.Workaround
Chrome is not affected. Please temporarily use Chrome to export the users.
fields.summary: "Export User" option on the "Portal-only customers" page does not work on IE11 and Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Site administrators need to manually check the application user base searching for inactive, but billable, users and depending on the company size that job is burdensome.
h3. Suggested Solutions

Create a feature where the site admin can program a delete user cronjob based on the user's inactivity period (i.e. remove from the application all users that are not active for the last 180 days).
fields.summary: Auto remove inactive users from the application's user management.

fields.description: As an administrator I would like to customize the login options on the login screen for my instance, for example, select if my instance should allow the *Continue with Google*, *Continue with Microsoft* or *Continue with Apple* options.
fields.summary: Allow customization on the login screen (enable or disable social login)
Add CAPTCHA/Security Questions to Password Reset Process

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Any user that has the email domain claimed will not be able to access the Email & Security section under manage account from *Jira Home* section as shown in the screenshot below:
 - !image-2018-06-04-22-45-02-946.png|width=186,height=236!

 * !image-2018-06-04-22-46-26-171.png|width=384,height=280!
 * !image-2018-06-04-22-47-13-696.png|width=396,height=308!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Need a domain claimed account
 # Log into the instance
 # https://<Atlassian URL>/people/search
 # Choose the domain claimed account avatar, click on *Manage account* and click on the (Email & Security section)
 # The page returns empty page

h3. Expected Results
 - Ability to see the content from both mentioned section

h3. Actual Results
 - returns blank page

Workaround
- Log into id.atlassian.com to get these Email & Security details.
fields.summary: Pages under manage account section is blank

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61946].
  {panel}

*Background* 
The JIRA username field has different valid characters than the email field. This creates an unfriendly situation when you add a customer in JSD. When you invite/add a new customer to JSD from the customers page, JSD creates the user using the email address as a username. If you invite/add the new customer from User Management, you can choose a different username.

*Scenario*
1. In JSD project Customers page, Agent invites/adds customer using an email address that contains characters that are not valid in the username field (e.g. &). JSD tries to use the email address as the username, and can't because the username field does not allow &.
2. Dialog throws the following err: Email address contains characters that aren’t valid in the username. Add the user, then use the username to add the user to the project. (Add the user is a CTA to User Management)
3. User has to go to UM, add the user, then go back to the project & invite the user using the username instead of the email.

This is confusing & also a pain because you have to leave your task, to go UM, then go back to your task.
fields.summary: JIRA username and email fields have different valid characters

fields.description:
Here is a scenario that customer would like resolved :
{quote}SSO Azure SAML setup at Identity Manager does not allow Azure Groups for setting permissions in Confluence and JIRA as a cloud app.
{quote}
It is ideal for administrators of SAML integration with Atlassian Cloud Identity Manager to have this functionality of having a one point group access which also can set permission at both at application level and SAML provider level.
fields.summary: SAML setup in Identity Manager should allow Groups Manipulation at Application access level

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition

Currently, the "Export users to CSV" feature has a cap of 20k users accounts, which is not ideal for instances with a high number of Service Desk customers.

It would be great to have the ability to either export over 20k users at once or have the possibility to paginate the export.

h4. Workaround

Contact the Atlassian Support for a workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to export 20k+ users to CSV
